social_background.living_situation: Lives with daughter who is also caretaker

religion.practice: Attends church in the next town, lifelong member since childhood

social_background.occupation: Homemaker, never worked outside the house
social_background.immigration_history: Born in Ethiopia, immigrated to the U.S. in 1968 at age 28

substance_use.alcohol: Rarely drinks, only for special occasions (e.g., a glass of wine)

social_background.income: Lives with daughter and receives little to no social security income

siblings.cause: Infection related to poorly controlled Type 2 Diabetes

past_conditions: History of breast cancer with right mastectomy and lymph node removal
History of lymphedema in the right upper extremity (RUE)

coping_and_stress_tolerance.strategy: Leans on religion and religious community for support

health_perception.daughter_view: Health is 'not great'; concerns about memory and mobility
health_perception.patient_view: Feels 'old, but doing well considering her medical problems'

functional_status.IADLs: Struggles with some; receives help from daughter
functional_status.living_support: Lives with daughter who helps care for her

mobility.pre-hospitalization: Ambulated without cane or walker, used furniture to steady herself
mobility.current: Daughter reports worsening strength and coordination

functional_status.exercise: Does not engage in any regular exercise

appointments_and_support.family_visits: Sees grandchildren and great-grandchildren many times a month

surgical_history.procedure: Right breast mastectomy and lymph node resection

er_admission.reason_for_admission: Fall resulting in left hip fracture and left hemothorax
treatment: Open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF) of left hip
Emergent chest tube placement for hemothorax

physician_orders.activity: Out of bed (OOB) 3 times a day to chair with 1 assist and walker
hip_precautions: Do not bend the hip more than 90 degrees
Do not cross legs or feet
Do not roll or lie on your unoperated side for the first 6 weeks
Do not twist the upper body when standing
physician_orders.SCDs: To be worn at all times when in bed or sitting in the chair

nutrition_and_gi.oral_health: Wears full upper and lower dentures
nutrition_and_gi.hydration_status: Appears slightly dehydrated; tenting at clavicle

abdominal_exam.palpation: No guarding, no masses, no tenderness

diet.tolerance: Tolerates well but with decreased appetite due to drowsiness and breathing difficulty
diet.intake: Generally finishes half of her meals

subjective.appetite: Decreased; reports not feeling hungry and scared to eat due to sensation of breathlessness

urinary.subjective: Has accidents when bladder is full or while out

vision.subjective: Reports blurry vision even with glasses, but can read with effort

hearing.subjective: Needs higher TV volume, dislikes using hearing aids

sleep.night_waking: Multiple times to use the bathroom
sleep.medication: Takes trazodone at night, helps slightly

value_belief_pattern.church_involvement: Attends Jehovah's Witness church in neighboring town, lifelong member

sensory_perception.description: Slightly limited: Responds to verbal commands but cannot always communicate discomfort or need to be turned, or has some sensory impairment limiting ability to feel pain in 1 or 2 extremities.

moisture.description: Occasionally moist: Skin is occasionally moist, requiring an extra linen change approximately once a day.

activity.description: Chairfast: Ability to walk severely limited or non-existent. Cannot bear own weight and/or must be assisted into chair or wheelchair.

mobility.description: Very limited: Makes occasional slight changes in body or extremity position but unable to make frequent or significant changes independently.

nutrition.description: Probably inadequate: Rarely eats a complete meal, eats only about half of food offered. Protein intake includes ~3 servings of meat or dairy per day. Occasionally takes dietary supplements.

friction_and_shear.description: Potential problem: Moves feebly or needs minimal assistance. Skin may slide during repositioning. Maintains good position most of the time but occasionally slides down.
